alert.note: Alert for Carlisle; Graves; Marshall; McCracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 17 at 5:54PM EST until February 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR CARLISLE, GRAVES, MCCRACKEN AND MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 454 PM CST, Though the heavy rainfall has ended, it may take a little longer for flooding of some roadways to recede. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Emergency Management, trained spotters and public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paducah, Mayfield, Metropolis, Benton, Calvert City, Bardwell, Lone Oak, Reidland, Sedalia, Barkley Regional Airport, West Paducah, Lynnville, Wingo, Hardin, Kevil, Arlington, Water Valley, Symsonia, Lowes and Fancy Farm. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
